odditude.why: The ‘unit of work’ shifting to multi-agent teams acting across tools is structurally weird; governance has to attach to behavior traces, not just model outputs.

itchiness.why: High volatility × impact: adoption is accelerating inside IDEs/data platforms, but security and audit gaps can create sudden enterprise freezes or buying sprees.

sexappeal.why: Agent week everywhere; developer audiences and execs both care. ‘Agent governance’ is a crisp, trendy framing with budget behind it.

odditude.why: Not surprising that policy follows robotics, but the tight coupling of rover autonomy + robotics commission + chip divestment reads like strategic reclassification.

itchiness.why: Regulatory mechanisms can rapidly reshape robotics markets; national-security hooks can force abrupt supplier changes.

sexappeal.why: Robotics is hot, but policy/infrastructure angles are less clicky than ‘agents in IDEs’ unless packaged well.

candidates.label: Yield is the policy battleground (AI as cost-wedge)

odditude.why: The yield fight is classic fintech politics; the odd part is mapping AI cost compression into incentive design.

itchiness.why: Outcomes hinge on policy timelines; product teams can pivot quickly, but legislative uncertainty slows immediate execution.

sexappeal.why: Stablecoins remain culturally magnetic; tying it to AI-enabled economics could make it more compelling to builders/investors.
